alert.note: Alert for Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:29PM MDT until October 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected, mainly above 8,500 feet. Snow accumulation will vary greatly with elevation. Generally 3 to 6 inches above 9,000 feet. Higher amounts over 10 inches possible above 10,000 feet. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 6 PM MDT Tuesday. The heaviest period of snow will be tonight through Tuesday morning, decreasing Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel in the mountains could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Little to no snow is expected along Highway 28 over South Pass.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Be prepared for cold and wet conditions if spending time in the backcountry.
